title: Is writer’s block a sign that I’m not good at writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is writer’s block a sign that I’m not good at writing? No. One has nothing to do with the other. Almost all writers experience the horrible “block.” All of them have to discover their own way out of it, whether on their own or through advice online or who knows where. If you haven’t noticed, Quora has no small number of answers for the questions. It’s just that the questions are worded a bit differently. Since I might assume you’re a writer-in-progress at least, then you ought to have the research acuity to do this on your own, either with Quora, a Google search, or other references you might stumble upon. There exist hundreds - possibly thousands - of suggestions on how to break the almighty, horrible, frustrating, dream-killer FACT of the BLOCK! Just go to any search line and type in “writer’s block.” As far as that being a sign you’re not good at writing - no one can assign that to you. You need to move through all the trials and tribulations we all do, attend to good advice, learn to recognize advice-for-money, and plow ahead. Best to you. If you love it, it’ll love you back. Hang in there.

Not necessarily, it might be a sign that you are good at writing. If by ‘block’ you simply mean the fact that you find it very hard to write, then that is a sign that you are doing it right. Because every writer, every real writer, knows that the task is very difficult. The great German novelist Thomas Mann once said, ‘a writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for others’. So rather than be put off by difficulty, you should be encouraged. And the only way I know to get through the difficult times is to cultivate a writing habit. Appoint a certain time every day, the same time every day, and sit down and write. And if nothing comes, sit there anyway. If you keep doing that consistently, day after day, the muse will deliver. I hope this helps a little bit. If you want any more help with your writing you might like to check out my free novel writing course here.

No, you are simply experiencing a lull in your creative process. Do anything to get your mind off the act of writing, like taking a walk or pursuing a favorite activity. If you have a recording app on your cellphone, take it with you. Record your random thoughts. Do not worry about grammar or where you’ve stashed your thesaurus. Do not worry how the words sound as they come out of your mouth. Just freely associate. And if you carry your cellphone to record your thoughts, do not, I repeat, do not take calls or make them. This is your time alone.

I wouldn't say so. Everyone is blocked at some point. It's what you do with that block that determines if you'll succeed or not, but that doesn't have to do with the quality of your writing. Writing is a skill we have to learn, and that includes the process. Sometimes you have to drop an idea and sometimes your process isn't right and sometimes you just need a small break before you can get back into the flow of writing again. Good luck, I hope you figure it out soon

Nope. Not even a little bit. Writers block happens to all of us. It doesn't mean you're a bad writer, just means you should probably take a break. Take a step back from the story. Read it. Maybe even give it to someone else to read, and ask for their opinion on where it should go. And then come back, and (if you do it like i do) take a metaphorical sledge hammer to that block and power through. Writers block just means you're a writer, not that you're a bad one.

response.answer_text: Nope. In my experience, it could be a sign you’re good at writing. My worst (months-long) writer’s block was because I was about to completely mess up my story. My subconscious noticed before my brain, and stopped me from going on with such abysmal plans. It might be this, it might be another reason. Don’t give up so easily!

response.answer_text: Absolutely not. It’s not about being ‘good enough’ to get out of the block, but it’s about finding the right material and motivations to get you into a passionate flux. Your best bet would be to look into what you have around you for ideas. Find a topic, genre, time span, or even old tale of folklore to get you going again. It requires some dedicated time of researching, yes, but it’ll be worth the work when you start rolling out all your ideas and soon enough, you’ll have a few paragraphs.

response.answer_text: Writers block is nothing more than your internal editor telling you your story has lost direction. You need to revaluate your story (or characters) and see where it went off. Just a hint. ALL writers think they are bad at writing. It’s just that some aren’t as bad as others.

No, writer’s block happens for a million reasons. But it has nothing to do with your writing ability. I’ve published 27 books so far and I still get writer’s block at times. I can recognize it and I know what to do for it for me. But I also know why I’m getting it, too.

response.answer_text: Absolutely not. The best of writers suffer from writers block! Just keep writing even if its bad, you can fix it later. Dont let your ideas die. You may not be able to spice it up during a writing drought but you can still get it out and come back to it later.
